website_summaries.verdict: A simple desk or table-side accessory that keeps warm beverages the perfect drinking temperature.
pros: Warms up the beverage in your mug in 2 minutes, or keeps hot drinks drinking temperature
Simple design with on and off switch
cons: Must be careful not to touch the hot plate, and no auto shut-off, so must remember to turn off

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Produces 220+ degrees while drawing approximately 17 watts and has plenty of cord.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works well with proper accessories
customer_reviews.text: After using this bad boy for over 4 years I can say definitively there are 2 things you really need for this to be effective at keeping your bevarage warm/hot. 1. Place a silicone lid cover like this:  on top of your mug while it sits, makes a HUGE difference. 2. Use traditional flat bottom mugs that don't have a lot of extra ceramic at the base where it makes contact with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Pooch

customer_reviews.title: perfect warmer for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my tea warm I figured I could use it on the cup but actually decided to try it on the pot I have a small 24oz pot and I sip on tea all day and it stays quite hot to where I have to let it cool a bit before I can drink it hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Will Not Keep Coffee Hot - Despite Heroic Efforts - End Of The Story
customer_reviews.text: It will not keep coffee hot. Don't waste your money with foolish hopes. I tried a ceramic mug and it did not stay hot. I tried a flat bottom mug to get more surface contact. ceramic is not the best conductor of heat. I bought a flat bottom this metal 'camping. mug. Coffee stayed barely warm, as in not cold not as in drinking temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Bill You

customer_reviews.title: This is a joke!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a joke!!! If you like your coffee lukewarm then get this. If you like your coffee at least as hot as when your poured it forget this!!! So very disappointed!!!! Never again!!! Wouldn't let me give less than a star otherwise I wouldn't have given it one!
customer_reviews.author: N.M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this for my father as his 20 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father as his 20 year old one crapped out. It was also a Mr Coffee, and this one is highly rated on amazon so I purchased it. It barely keeps the coffee luke warm, and we tried it extensively with many different kinds of mugs. They even sent me a second one and I had similar results. Ended up purchasing the Mickey Mouse mug warmer (weird I know) which works very well with all sorts of mugs.
customer_reviews.author: J. H

customer_reviews.title: A Big disappointment After less than 1 minute of plugging it on
customer_reviews.text: A Big disappointment After less than 1 minute of plugging it on, the device started sending out fumes, and i first thought it was normal as it was heating up, but then the circular plate where you place the mug just fell down as the boundaries melted!!! Such a rip off !
customer_reviews.author: Zina Oran

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. I sent one back and ordered another. Just used it. And just like the previous one it doesn’t work. Does not keep the hot tea hot. It’s lukewarm at best. And both I’m pretty sure were used and returned. I bought the first one because of most reviews stated the warmer was great. The two I got sure weren’t. I’ll return this one too and order a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Forester

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get hot enough to heat anything.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several ceramic coffee mugs, all non-insulated, and my coffee will NOT stay above luke warm. I've left it on for 15 minutes up to 15 hours and it will not heat my coffee nor keep it hot. I have also used coffee cups that have built in lids and this thing still doesn't keep it above luke warm. I like my coffee hot, not boiling, but hot. This does not work for what I need. Sure it's durable, easy to clean and use but IT DOESN'T WORK for it's intended purpose so I give it 1 star since I have to give it something.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Woods

customer_reviews.title: Grumpy says No!
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressed and definitely wish I had purchased more expensive model, which I will probably have to buy anyway. Maybe some people would have better luck with and find it sufficient, but here is what I found: Very lightweight, moves around, have to hold it down to turn switch on and off Switch is very hard to slide At first it kept my tea too hot, now it isn't much above tepid There you go. Grumpy says No! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: S. O. Rooney MA GGCP

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Shortly After Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm really frustrated-- for the first two weeks, this thing worked like a dream. I loved how it kept my coffee and tea at an ideal temperature (hot, but drinkable, and stable for a considerable amount of time regardless of the mug). Then, quite suddenly, it stopped warming the drinks. I bought this after using a friend's, and she'd had hers for over a year without incident, so I'm not sure why mine had to be defective, but here we are. I'm ordering another, but if it doesn't hold up, I'll be writing a follow-up review.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndi

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This cup warmer is very affordable but it’s just basic / okay. I received a gift of another brand (Vobaga) and based on my comparison, this other brand is nicer. The on/off switch on Mr. Coffee unit is stiff and awkwardly placed at the back of the burner; on Vobaga it is in front and has a touch design with LED indicator light. Vobaga has 3 heat settings. I also prefer Vobaga’s white case and wall cord. Nothing wrong with Mr. Coffee unit, the price is right, but there are nicer units.
customer_reviews.author: Rose S. in Florida

customer_reviews.title: I found the catch
customer_reviews.text: When this desktop coffee warmer arrived and I used it for the first time I was pleasantly surprised, it kept my coffee warm long enough to drink it between meetings and putting out the next "office fire". I was weary to purchase this because of the price, I didn't have high hopes but it had better reviews than other options. I knew there had to be a catch... and I found it. After about 4 uses it just quit heating up, just gave up. I had such high hopes.. oh well, next time ill purchase an item of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ajo1117

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Coffee warmer (beware)
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine 6 months ago. It was the best purchase I'd ever made until one night I could not sleep and as I sat on the sofa beside my warmer I smelled an electrical smell. I searched everywhere until I saw smoke coming from the warmer. I immediately unplugged it. I waited for it to cool then disassembled it to see what had happened. It had completely melted the soldered joints on the electrical board inside and they shorted against each other. I was so relieved I couldn't sleep or my house and myself would no longer be here. This was terribly frightening!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my coffee warm but it very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Do be careful with the last 2-3 mouthfuls of hot beverage because it gets very hot when the cup is nearly empty. Also, recognize that the warmer is very lightweight and easily slides on the table or desk. My dog swatted at it yesterday before I set my cup on it and sent it flying onto the floor, so be watchful. But that said, I'm pleased with the warmer and it does keep my coffee and tea nice and warm. I like that the cord is long enough to allow me to plug it in close to where I'm sitting.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Careful of the coating
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these simply because it seems to get a bit warmer than the more up to date looking one I tried. However while the first I purchased is still like day one. The 2nd. Purchase has had problems right out from the box. The coating is coming right off of it. Not sure why. I am using plain glass mug with smooth bottom on it just like the other warmer with no issues at all. Only had this 2nd. One for a few weeks and it looks like someone has hacked at it to death just from a few uses due the peeling coating. Not sure what the problem is.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: How does this have such high reviews?
customer_reviews.text: Day one, second use: light started flickering and wouldn't maintain heat. Switched to a different outlet, and it somewhat maintained. The next week, the paint has completely chipped off the hot plate. So, we're on week one of owning this thing, and i can't wait for the fun surprises I am sure is to come if I'm already having such problems. I trusted the high number of good reviews, but unfortunately, I was disappointed with the product and its ability to maintain the temperature of my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Unfortunately the warmer does not get hot enough to keep anything warm. It truly depends on the type of coffee cup you are using. I have ceramic cups and some glass cups. The ceramic cups never get warm enough to make a difference. The glass cup gets warm enough to keep the BOTTOM of your coffee warm. I would not purchase this product again. I still turn it on and use it for some reason, but it does not really do anything. NOTE: If you forget to turn it off... it will stay on all night, or in my case... ALL WEEKEND :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this warmer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great warmer for the price. I have one in various rooms in my home and also at my office. I drink a lot of coffee and I want hot coffee to stay hot. This warmer keeps coffee at the perfect temperature so the coffee stays 'good to the last drop'. Please note that this warmer doesn't cut off automatically. so if that's important to you, it may be a drawback. I personally prefer it over 'auto cut off' but I see where this might be a safety concern for some people. I ordered two warmers and I was pleased to receive my package promptly and in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Ann H.

customer_reviews.title: Luke Warm At Best
customer_reviews.text: The unit simply does not have the ability to maintain a warm enough coffee temperature for anyone who enjoys hotter coffee. I use it at work, and I've tried all different types of mugs, including the thinnest walled, smallest cups we have. It did not make a difference. The coffee from the pot cools down almost as quickly as setting it on the desk. It does hit a certain temp which then it stays at, but I believe most people would still refer to it as drinking "cold" coffee. I believe my unit is probably working properly as the surface temp of the heating pad to the touch is hot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed this warmer doesn't keep my coffee/tea hot
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed this warmer doesn't keep my coffee/tea hot. It keeps it warm but I like my drink really hot. I am going back to my thermos which keeps it hot for 4 hours, and warm for several more hours! I gave it to my coworker who likes her drink warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well With Thin Ceramic Cups
customer_reviews.text: I keep this on my desk in my home office, and use it to 2-3 times a week to keep plain coffee warm during the day. It doesn't keep coffee piping hot, but will keep it from getting cold for 8 hours or more. The hardest part of using this is finding the right type of cup. I've gotten several of the $9 microwave- and dishwasher-safe ceramic cups from Hobby Lobby. The walls are thinner than standard mugs, and work well with the warmer, but the cups keep cracking during washing, which is a bummer. Be warned: This warmer DOES NOT not work well with thick mugs, and doesn't work AT ALL on paper cups from your local coffee shop!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not enough wormth
customer_reviews.text: I might be looking for something I cannot get but I was hoping to have something that would hold a hot cup of coffee at a hot Temp. but that was not the case. after 20 minutes of pouring the coffee it cooled down to luke warm not at all suitable for me anyway and I still run back and forth to heat in the microwave. Somewhat disappointed which rarely happens to me through Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Judith K. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Smells Dreadful!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged it in, the room started to smell like burned plastic. Ok, I thought, I'll put it on the porch and run it for a day. Then another day. After running for two days, it still smelled like burning plastic. You also have to manually switch off the burner. For safety's sake it would be better to get one that automatically shuts off when the mug has been removed for over 5 minutes. Did I mention it smells awful?
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Fincher

customer_reviews.title: does what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: I've had experience with other mug warmers (at work) and wasn't overly thrilled. Usually you'll find they keep your coffee warm, but if you like HOT coffee, they aren't satisfactory. This warmer, however, is not only reasonably priced, but does a bang up job! It actually keeps things HOT!! I bought two for the house...one for next to my husband's armchair and one for next to mine. We've had them almost a week, and are extremely pleased. The cord is long, it has an on/off switch, and it doesn't retain heat once it's turned off. We heartily recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: dps

customer_reviews.title: perfect for melting cocoa butter to use on your skin
customer_reviews.text: I like to use pure cocoa butter on my skin. It has to be melted, as it is solid at normal room temperatures. Most people try to microwave the butter. I figured out how to use this mug warmer. Just place the butter in a small ceramic baking ramekin and place on the warmer. Within minutes, butter is liquid and warm feels so good on the skin, plus the heat releases wonderful aroma. To keep surface clean, cover with some folded sheets of parchment paper (like kind used for baking). It can handle the heat. Parchment paper, not wax paper, often people use it interchangeably in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: MCR

customer_reviews.title: It is a hotplate, and it works for that
customer_reviews.text: I mean the plate heats up and works well for that. THere is not much to it, a power button, a heating surface, and some raised rubberized feet and a longish cord. However the paint they used on the heating surface is horrible. The FIRST time I placed a mug on it it scraped the paint off. Its not like it was slammed down or slid across the surface. Just, gently placed on it. Not a dealbreaker, but just a cheap manufacturing choice which I hope doesnt mean the rest of the product is cheaply manufactured. Im hoping that doesnt mean it will fall apart or stop working in a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fallert

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and it works
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cup warmer, and I've tried several. My critique is something that applies to all types: the surface isn't large enough for the flat-bottomed mugs I finally found. Where do people find them??? I collect mugs, and from all over the world, and not a single one has a flat bottom. I finally found a hand-made one on Amazon, $26 but nice. It's a bit too wide to fit on the warmer, but it works, and I'm happy. (I HATE coffee that isn't hot.) The cord isn't long enough but I use an extension cord. I'm so glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Woods

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that this actually keeps the cup heated from the bottom up which means the more you drink, the warmer the temperature. However, if you cover your mug and put it on the heating pad right away? The entire drink will be the same, hot temperature. It was easy to use, the cord is so long so there are no problems of where to plug it in. I’ve used it on stone and wood surfaces and it has not burnt anything, it is slightly elevated so that this doesn’t happen. It doesn’t take long to warm up and gets really hot. I love this product so far and will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Clean looks, on off slider switch with an on light, Good cord that is about 5 foot 5 inches long also, and that makes it much more useable, like at your desk or on a side table at your favorite chair at home. It is 17 watts in power, which I believe is marginal, to keep a cup of coffee hot enough if you enjoy yours slowly. (I m a sipper, a sip at a time ) However it is the most powerful one I could find, as most are a lowly 14 watt. Find a good ceramic cup with a fully flat bottom has helped me, but I bet a 20 watt would just be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Warms adequately.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had a Mr. Coffee mug warmer that I had bought in 1992 that lasted all these years, and I loved it. That one had an auto on/off foot that would turn on with a mug on and when you lifted it up, would shut off. It had an auto shut off feature after a certain length of time. It was safe. Not a problem until a plastic piece inside broke after 27 years! This one has a manual on/off switch, and I don't care for that. It has a light at least as a reminder. It warms adequately. Just not the same as it used to be. Miss my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Amethyst

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Within the first 30 minutes the bottom plate scratched. I imagine many average ceramic mugs will not be perfect on the bottom. It heats, seems to get fairly warm. I measured the plate anywhere between 150-200 degrees. Under the warmer it measures about 100-115 on the surface of the table. It barely keeps the coffee hot in the mug I use. Again, a pretty basic ceramic mug. Warmer than without it, yes, but not much. Maybe it is better with a glass cup or thin ceramic. Certainly not worth more than $10.
customer_reviews.author: pkdesign

customer_reviews.title: Non-returnable, waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these and neither keep your coffee/drink hot unless you use a paper cup. In addition, they are not returnable, even though it does not state that anywhere on the site when purchasing. Really expected better product and/or policy from Amazon. Disappointed. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AdamR

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This product works well to keep your mug hot. I want to make the distinction with "keep" because it won't reheat a mug that's gone cold. Which is good because I'm sure it would be a safety hazard otherwise. Keep your freshly made mug on the warmer, and it will stay nice and hot for hours. I see what people are saying about needing a lid for your cup. The warmer heats from the bottom of your mug (obviously), so to really capitalize on that, a lid would be best to heat your coffee all the way through. I haven't purchased one yet, but I may in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my boss happy
customer_reviews.text: Update: This warmer is still working great; however, within about three months of very light use, the paint started chipping off the hot plate. Doesn’t look real impressive especially since it was a gift. Original review: This is perfect for the corner of my boss’s desk. It has a small footprint and low profile. The on-off button is on the unit itself - not on the cord - so it’s easier to get to. It keeps coffee plenty warm but I don’t worry about the burner getting overly hot. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: sunshan

customer_reviews.title: Lukewarm coffee
customer_reviews.text: I expected this thing to keep my coffee / tea at hot, serving temperature. Like the one I had before for years (different brand). But I have to keep reheating my coffee in the microwave every 30 minutes or so. (I know, I know ... I'm a slow coffee drinker / sipper). Also, the black paint on the round part where the coffee mug sits has already peeled / chipped off. Nit-picky? It's barely 30 days of use and it looks and performs like it is 30 years old. NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could use this
customer_reviews.text: Works like it’s supposed to. Priced well. Isn’t hot enough. Isn’t heavy enough, you really need to have it very close to the plug or the plate scoots around your desk or coffee table. I would still continue to use it but, for me, keeping my coffee on this “hot plate” gives me terrible heartburn. Weird, I know, but it’s the truth. I use a 1 cup-at-a-time drip coffee maker (Melitta) & if it cools off too much I nuke it, but I was really hopeful that this would work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonlady

customer_reviews.title: Works...but....
customer_reviews.text: This warmer works as you would expect. But.....the paint in the area where you set the cup is already chipping off after only TWO uses. Those white specks in the photo are not dust or other debris. They are simply the silver of whatever surface is beneath the black coating. While the warmer works, it would look a lot nicer without the peeling/chipping paint. If this happened after only two uses, what will it look like by this time next year? Or even in a few months?
customer_reviews.author: LittleBrownBear900

customer_reviews.title: Works great but may scratch easily.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using this to keep my latté or tea warm, especially since I tend to slowly sip! This keeps me savoring and enjoying my beverage. The only thing is I’ve only used this a handful of times and already see a small silver scratch where the cup took off the black paint covering of this. Kind of disappointing and why I’m dinging a star. Also, the cord length is a little on the short side. Still, I’m very happy with my purchase and am enjoying this magic little contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control
customer_reviews.text: There is no control for temperature. It is either "on" or "Off". While it keeps my coffee at a temperature good for me, it doesn't keep it as hot as my husband likes his. I always tend to let my coffee sit to cool for a few minutes but he likes his piping hot from the pot! I like the fact that I can put mine on this and leave room knowing when I come back it will still be at drinking temperature for me. Overall, I am quite happy with my purchase and would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: don-d-lite

customer_reviews.title: Good but paint comes off
customer_reviews.text: I'm the type of person that doesn't like to drink cold warm drinks so this is a great purchase for me. The warmth depends on the mugs you use (some heat last longer than others). The paint on the temp part doesn't fall off after a long use (I only have mine for about a month and the pain already has fallen around the area where my mug has been). It doesn't damage the mug but if you don't like scratches or worn out looking appliances then this isn't the purchase for you.
customer_reviews.author: LilKuma

customer_reviews.title: Best mug warmer out there
customer_reviews.text: I got my boyfriend one of these for Christmas last year and loved it so much that I got myself one! I searched around for less expensive ones and completely wasted my time and bough and returned 2-3 of these from other brands before buying this one. Don't even waste your time trying to save a few bucks; all the other warmers I tried were absolute crap and did not keep my coffee warm. Not only does this one KEEP my coffee WARM it sometimes makes it HOTTER! Hands down the best warmer out there. Would recommend for anyone who drinks lots of coffee; also makes a great functional gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Good enough!
customer_reviews.text: This won’t magically keep your coffee piping hot. But as a student currently doing class from home, my coffee would be ice cold within an hour. I’m sure for more money you could get a much better warmer, but this keeps it at a warm temperature for hours. not hot, but warm which is enough for me. and for $9 you can’t go wrong with it. it’s just one temperature, but that’s okay. and i’m glad you can use your own mugs (unlike some where you have to use the mug it comes with.)
customer_reviews.author: Colin Williams

customer_reviews.title: No more cold tea
customer_reviews.text: No more cold tea or coffee.. reheating my coffee or tea in the microwave changes the taste and then I no longer want to drink it. This mug warmer is perfect for me. Keeps my drinks at a constant warm temperature .... in other reviews people have said that it gets too hot and burned their desk. I would never leave anything hot plugged in overnight but it is on for quite a few hours in the day... so as a precautionary measure I use a trivett designed for hot pans under the mug warmer. It won't keep your drinks "hot" but they will stay at a constant warm temperature. I am very happy with this product...
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Mr Coffee Mug Warmer does okay job at keeping mugs of liquid warm
customer_reviews.text: It was given as a 3-star rating due to it doing an okay job at keeping a mug of liquid warm/lukewarm. It has nothing in the way of temperature controls, as it does a barely-sufficient transfer of heat from the heated warming plate surface to a mug sitting on top of it. The cord length for it is about 4 feet long, so it is nicely long in that aspect, but nothing other than an orange "working" light to show the power switch is in On position & heating plate is hot for the "safety" features.
customer_reviews.author: Sci-Fi _Star Trek fan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  for people who walk away from their coffee
customer_reviews.text: I am a person who prepares a cup of coffee, gets distracted and ends up walking away from it only to find out it has gone cold when I come back. My problem is solved with this and I love it. I Wish it came with some kind of a lid. The coffee stays warm, a very nice temperature, and it doesn’t change the taste. Not much more you could ask for except that it was battery operated perhaps, but maybe that’s a safety issue. I chose this because a friend of mine has it and loves it so I decided to try it and I’m glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: MVMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Quick, hot, affordable and flexible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale and one of the cheapest options available that could be delivered through prime. I was pleasantly surprised with the chord length (we don’t have a lot of plugs in our apartment so it needed to be longer) and have really been enjoying having hot coffee during so many long zoom calls. It rests on the desk which also serves as my bedside table so my only fear is leaving it on next to my pillow or accidentally turning it on. However the on/off switch requires a good amount of pressure to switch so I don’t think it will be inadvertently bumped on. So far I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: It's a WARMER
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind this is a coffee warmer, not a coffee heater. It won't make cool drinks hot or even keep them hot. What it will do is keep them from getting cold. The more full the cup the less hot it is. As the level in the cup gets lower the contents get warmer until it is actually somewhat hot near the bottom. This works out fine if you are slowly but continually drinking your coffee. But if you let it sit for a while while still full, it will be somewhat tepid. Otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was fair budget for the right style and type of mug warmer I wanted. But after removing from its box and protective wrappers, then plugging in, I discovered the damage. The hot surface plate had several scrape marks AND a slight 'ring' stain around its outer edge, indicating it must have been previously used when I bought it as new. And the outer plastic casing had some cosmetic 'dimpling', which I found a bit odd. I returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Leanette T.

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Keep Coffee Warm
customer_reviews.text: Reviews for this item are all over the place but I am a Mr Coffee product fan so I ordered. It did not keep coffee warm. I tried 3 different types of mugs and it made no difference. Pipping hot coffee did not stay at a desired temperature. I used as directed and out of the box it just didn't keep coffee warm enough to enjoy drinking it. My previous warmer I had for years before it stopped working so I know how to utilize these. Not recommended in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Warmer!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish they would make the plate so the color don’t rub off, it started coming off in two days time. It does heat pretty good, would love if it was a little hotter. But it does keep my coffee good an warm from that first sip to the last sip!!! My husband drinks his fast, not me I want to enjoy every drop An I want every drop hot as I can get it! I do like how the on/off is on the top not half way down the cord!!! I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine44

customer_reviews.title: A warm beverage on a cold and snowy day!
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these back in June 2016 after discovering the tried and true Brookstone versions had been discontinued. Researched most of the other brands out there and narrowed it down by wattage and past purchaser comments/opinions at different websites (to include Amazon). Keeps hot beverage warm, will not heat-up your beverage from a lukewarm or cold level. I note this only because of the many past purchaser comments that gave these and other brands low marks for not making their cold beverage piping hot! (?). These have kept our ceramic cups of coffee, tea and hot chocolate warm enough after pouring, all through our Wyoming winter this year (2016-17). Would buy again and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: angienav

customer_reviews.title: Rewriting Review to 1 Star Am Returning Both
customer_reviews.text: As far as keeping coffee warm, it was decent so I ordered a second one. The second one arrived with a black paint missing on the "burner" part. Next, my first one after 1 week of use, is now having paint come off too on the "burner" part. Under the place surface, it is plain metal, so it looks silver when paint comes off. Also not big fan of MR. COFFEE printer twice on the top. Returning both. Looking for one with more of a "nonstick Teflon" surface vs black paint on metal!!!
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: Some glassware works better than others
customer_reviews.text: This mug warmer is very effective in keeping coffee hot. However!... You need to carefully select which drinking vessel to use with it. If you use an insulated mug, for example, you will be very disappointed. What you need to use is glassware that is analogous to a coffee pot: relatively thin glass with a flat bottom. Then, the heat will transmit efficiently from the warmer to your drink, and your coffee will stay piping hot.
customer_reviews.author: Kent W

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made despite brand
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in the quality of a product with Mr. Coffee name. Made of cheap plastic. My beverage isn't much warmer than no warmer. Any less warm & it wouldn't be a hot beverage. This product came up in a search for warmer with self shut off. It isn't. I should've paid more attention there. Overall, I will buy something else soon. This piece of junk is a waste. I probably would be happier with a lower priced, no name warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lukewarm coffee... don't expect anything more.
customer_reviews.text: If you like lukewarm coffee, this is perfect. If you want your coffee to stay hot or even almost hot, don't waste your money on this. I thought if Mr. Coffee put their name on it, it would be a good product... not even close. It doubles as a candle warmer, and barely gets warm (not even close to hot) enough to melt wax and release the smell of the candles. The only reason it was not a one star... it plugs into a normal wall outlet, not USB like most of the other products. With 110v not 5v like USB, I thought I might be able to enjoy a hot cup of coffee without it going cold..not so.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for a stressed out momma!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I’m a stay at home mom and everyone knows when you’re taking care of a little one you don’t really have time to finish a drink in one sitting. This ensures my drink is still hot ( not too hot that it scalds my tongue) throughout the day! I love making a cup of tea and knowing it’s still going to be hot after putting the baby down for a nap or after feeding. No more microwaving cold drinks and worrying waking up the baby each time I use the microwave. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emma’s mom

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I literally use this every morning when waking up. It won’t keep your coffee super-steaming hot, but it will definitely keep it from getting cold quick. It gives you time to sit and enjoy a hot cup of coffee for an extended period. It’s worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Buzzed, popped, sparked and died in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: So, this unit does what it says, but it's a fire hazard. Very scary to think what a simple device could have done! I recently plugged it on and it buzzed briefly for a couple seconds, then sparked and made a pop. It obviously fried some electronics as it is dead. Very cheaply made. The plastic around the top is also pretty cheap and can melt from its own use. Definitely avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, still great after two years of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over two years ago and, after lots of daily use, it’s still going strong. It’s durable - apparently very well made. A way to control the temp would be nice but as long as the bottom of the mug you use makes full contact with the heating surface (no gap) then your drink will stay hot enough. If not, keep it covered with some kind of lid. I’ve found that thick glass mugs work best.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Works but wish more safety features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a retired aunt who drinks coffee at home all day everyday but is easily distracted and has to reheat the coffee like 20 times before she finishes it. It does what it's supposed to, however she is moving around from room to room and not staying stationary so it doesn't really work for her lifestyle. If you're the type of person who sits at a desk or table in one spot, this is great for you! Not great for an adult with ADHD lol
customer_reviews.author: Mandi G

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Update: cat (normal size cat, maybe 7lbs) jumped up and walked across it (i watched, he only put one foot on it as he stepped) on the plate part knocking it inwards and breaking it. Cheaply made i guess. Original review: Second time using it and the paint off the hot plate part is coming off. I have only used a normal ceramic mug both uses. Also, it does keep it drink warm it doesnt seem to keep my drink hot. I've had better.
customer_reviews.author: Meda

customer_reviews.title: Works to keep my mug warm but scratches anytime you touch it.
customer_reviews.text: The product works and keeps my tea warm while I am working at home. However, the very minute you use it with any mug it immediately starts to scratch. This doesn't seem to impact the product but I don't like that it scratches so easy. I even returned the first one because I thought it was defective but this happens on both. Good product but be careful you don't damage it too much.
customer_reviews.author: S. Waller

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this warmer. 2 things that I learned... You want to put it on the warmer when your coffee is already warm. It keeps it at that temperature Also, it's best when your coffee mug is flat on the bottom. That way it has full contact with the heat. I just recieved it today and it's already scratched up. I was not being rough. I still like it and its inevitable that it was going to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Peña

customer_reviews.title: For international customers like me!
customer_reviews.text: I know this is common sense to use power converters for different countries or regions but I’m not an expert on this so I figured I’ll use whatever I’m currently using at home that works for a US appliance and nothing FITS this mug warmer’s plug thing, I don’t live in the US so this Plug looks alien to me, one side is wider than the other so I bought a Converter that fits this thing and that matches the power in the US So be sure to use something with the outPut of 110/120 V so it won’t explode and burn down your house. Also please make a USB plug wtf globalization people
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, affordable, keeps hot!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the slow busy coffee/tea drinker! It doesn’t heat up cold coffee but if you pour hot coffee/tea into the mug on top of the device it KEEPS it nice and hot. And I like my coffee HOT. Ok, I looked at other products on amazon etc. I looked at Ember mug/coaster. And although pretty the ember was expensive and this product is only $10.00 for the same thing! It’s worked great for me, has a nice long cord and does everything it advertises. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: She likes it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 80 year old cousin as she likes to keep a warm beverage next to her, yet this year had a surgery and then a fall. She rejected the whole idea of this, and said, " no, no, no," and I bought it anyway and just got her to try it. She likes it! SHE LIKES IT!! Yay! She lives alone, and I am pleased that she can get up if she chooses to, yet if she needs to keep her feet up or rest a bit then she will keep having fluids. Nice find, I'm still worried a bit, yet not as much about her falling.
customer_reviews.author: Purgandi Dracointerfectorem

customer_reviews.title: Good for small cups only.
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to keep my coffee/tea warm when I left my desk to run errands. The good side is this Mug warmer does work for <10 oz small cups with flat bottom, in case the original drink is hot not just warm; that is to say, it can keep the drink at similar temperature but not to warm it up. I also found it's kind of safety concern if you use tall mugs, especially when the mug is half full, because the lower part is hot and the top part still cold, the mug could break if leave it there for long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tea Warmer!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older one of these that I use everyday for my tea in the morning. As I work from home it gets a lot of use at my desk. Since Covid my husband has been working from home and has been jealous of my tea warmer. So I bought him one. He is happy with it. Works perfect. Just like mine. Don’t touch the heater it’s hot and can burn you. Also make sure you turn it off. It doesn’t shut off on its own.
customer_reviews.author: EFaasse

customer_reviews.title: Good value and preformance
customer_reviews.text: While this does keep coffee and tea nicely hot, the coating on the heating plate is not a good quality. Mine scratched and started chipping after less than week. I simply put the mug down and pick it up, no scraping or dragging. However, the function is still perfectly fine. Overall,I am glad I purchased the Mr Coffee mug warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for coffee lovers (or tea, ciders, etc)
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this coffee warmer for my husband as a Christmas present (and it fit it into his stocking (barely, but I got it in there to be a stocking stuffer). When he saw it, he looked it over on the outside of the box, opened it up, looked @ it and had an expression on his face that he really did not like it OR want it. So, I said, Just regift it to me. I'll use it on my nightstand while im working or reading in bed. It works out wonderful for me! I would recommend this product! Great GREAT value as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Cindrich

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT for keeping drinks hot
customer_reviews.text: This mug warmer works VERY well IF you use the correct sized mug...the base should be very close to the size of the pad of the Mr. Coffee warmer. If it fits properly, your drink will stay hot for many, many hours. If you want it piping hot, use a mug with a lid, too. Mr. Coffee would be smart to make and sell mugs that fit the base of this warmer. I am having a hard time finding a BIG coffee mug with a base that fits the warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coffee warm
customer_reviews.text: This is good for keeping the coffee warm, however, the surface starts peeling as soon as it's used. When it did it with the first one I bought I returned it for a new one. The second one did the same thing, so I just figured it wasn't worth it to try a 3rd one. It still works, even though it looks like I've had it for a year, even though it's been only a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Jaysee5

customer_reviews.title: Great product, awesome experiance
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and the first one showed as delivered, but I never got it. I was very sad, cause I drink coffee ALL DAY. My office is freezing and I hate cold coffee. Contacted Amazon and got a replacement ASAP. I love it!! No cold coffee, no trips to the kitchen to 'top off' my cup just to warm it back up. Great for tea, hot cocoa, anything! I've had cup warmers before but this is the first one I've had with a convenient switch right on top. Way better than fumbling under my desk for the cord switch on my last warmer.
customer_reviews.author: OCD-one

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says.
customer_reviews.text: It keeps beverages at an enjoyable temperature 10+ hours a day. It doesn't fit oversize mugs well (like the ones that hold 3 actual cups of something) but is perfect for standard mugs. Just wipe any spills off with a damp paper towel quickly and it stays really nice. Also good for soup in a mug. Makes a nice gift, it’s nice to get to finish a cup of coffee while it’s hot :)
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is pretty good, considering it only uses 17W of power. It keeps a full 12oz cup of coffee warm, and the less there is in the cup, the warmer it gets. However, I've only had it a few days, and already the coating is getting scratched off the warming plate. That's not very impressive for something with the Mr. Coffee name on it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Cord Length Great Warm Coffee
customer_reviews.text: The paint on the plate is already scratched and starting to come off and I just started using it less than 2 hours ago. This product works well after you've drank half your cup of coffee. After that its warm coffee till you finish the cup. Thats what its intended and designed for and it does it well. Overall not bad for the price. Buy one today.
customer_reviews.author: Brimstone

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't very happy with this product to begin with
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't very happy with this product to begin with, it didn't seem to be keeping my coffee hot - warmish but not hot like I expected. Went in to write a review about how disappointed I was and decided to pursue the other reviews and came across one that had the same problem. His solution was to put a silicone cover over his cup and it kept the coffee hot. It does! Maybe Mr. Coffee mentions it somewhere on the page but it's worth it to get a cover of some kind of keep the heat from escaping. Works very well now.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Eggum

customer_reviews.title: Did the same thing.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I ordered this coffee warmer last week and when I plugged it in and started using it the top part where you put your coffee cup started to come off. Each day it got worse. I had it probably 1week so I sent a message to the seller and the next day (Monday) the UPS man showed to to pick it up. Today I received a new one in the mail. Thank you Mr.Coffee!
customer_reviews.author: jyllian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Warmer
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is a good mug warmer, though I wish it were just a bit hotter. I like my coffee pretty warm/hot! However, I use a silicone cover in between sips, and that helps to keep the heat from escaping too much. My only real criticism is that after the first use, some of the black paint scraped off of the base that you place your cup on. However, that doesn't affect the performance of the warmer.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Like most Mr. Coffee products: a good value
customer_reviews.text: This simple, durable cup heater gets it done. Maintains a hot temperature for as long as you need. Sturdy base has 4 rubber feet that limit movement and keep the unit stable even with a heavy large cup. Generous power cord to reach a available outlet. The on/off switch is stiff but won’t accidentally turn on/off and the power indicator light is visible even in bright light. Very nice price.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Used Sold as New
customer_reviews.text: This item was sold as New, but it appears that it was Used. The attached picture is as it was when I received it, prior to me using the warmer for the first. The flap on the product packaging was not fully closed and the burner has what appears to be a burned ring (like what would happen if liquid dripped around the bottom of a cup while the burner was hot). The warmer seems to work okay so I'm not going to waste my time trying to trade it for an actual new one, but I am not very happy about this transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this is because I am one of those crazy coffee drinker that keeps warming my coffee. After 30-60 coffee was Luke warm and as you can see from the picture the black enamel is peeling I am returning it and hope Amazon refúnds me. I have had many of these over the years, but the quality of this i e is extremely poor.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Sugar

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep coffee warm
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep coffee warm. Start with a hot cup, it just gets colder as time goes by (not a lot of time). The wattage is 17. My prior "Mickey Mouse" mug warmer is/was 30 watts. That keeps the coffee HOT, and, it gets hotter as you drink because there is less coffee to warm. I tried this new one because the "Mickey Mouse" warmer died (after 3 years). Big mistake, it is so bad that the coffee gets colder as you drink, even at the bottom of the cup, it is cold by the time you're done. Consequently, I purchased another "Mickey Mouse" warmer and it is great again.
customer_reviews.author: Schindler

customer_reviews.title: No more cold coffee
customer_reviews.text: My coffee never gets cold anymore!! I got tired of having to reheat my coffee in the microwave because.....momlife. lol Thanks to this warmer, I can leave it unattended for a few mins to take care of the kids and its still hot/warm like when I left it. Several of the reviews say that it doesn't get that warm. My cup of coffee goes straight from the pouring to this warmer and its yet to let my coffee get cold. I've never tried putting my cold coffee on it to warm it back up. Will definitely recommend to all my other coffee loving mommy friends. :)
customer_reviews.author: Twid_mom

customer_reviews.title: going to have to try a glass mug and see if that works better. it's great if you drink your hot beverages ...
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised. problem is my mug i think. a ceramic mug will not allow the warmer to keep my coffee/tea hot, it's only stays warm (and not warm enough for my tastes). the warming plate is plenty hot but the heat won't transfer through the ceramic mug. going to have to try a glass mug and see if that works better. it's great if you drink your hot beverages fairly quickly but walk away and come back 30 min later and it's no hotter than what you can get from the tap.
customer_reviews.author: mike honcho

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended! Heating surface very delicate! Deep scratch marks with slight movements.
customer_reviews.text: While this Mr. Coffee mug warmer did keep my coffee warm (but not quite as hot as I would have liked), the quality of the heating surface was terrible. I returned it and got a replacement in the hopes that it was just a defective item. Nope. The 2nd one did the same thing. The scratches are so deep that it went all the way down to the base metal. (see pic) And this was with very light movements while lifting the cup to take a sip. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lurking in the Stacks

customer_reviews.title: If You Like Luke-Warm Coffee... This is For You!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for... and this is not worth what I paid for it... as it does not function as a "coffee warmer" should. Let me rephrase that: I was hoping for a "coffee heater"... (keep my coffee 'heated' and not simply luke warm...). It does plug in, heat the surface, and had a light that goes off/on when you use the switch. That said, the $10 is better spent on a thermos-type coffee mug... that will actually keep the coffee "hot" for some time, vs. luke-warm in 30-min. (and a person in need of a coffee heater NEEDS one because they drink their mug of coffee slow... over an hour or so...)...
customer_reviews.author: P-Dog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect temp, perfect size, and I want more!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a cool idea. I not using it for a coffee cup or soup, but for to warm up candles. The jars fit on top nicely, and don’t get overheated. This is perfect for this. I am not much for smoke in the house, but love nice smelling candles smelling up the entire house. Perfect warmer and I’d love to have one for every single room. Probably will buy more soon. :)
customer_reviews.author: jenjen

customer_reviews.title: HOT HOT HOT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this new coffee heater! Just make sure that you pay attention to the warnings. ONLY use a ceramic cup, nothing made from plastic. Be prepared, when you pick up your coffee cup, it can be VERY HOT, and cause you to jump or reflex drop it. If you like to sip your coffee, this is the gadget that makes it impossible to do anything else! haha. LOVE IT! The only con, is the control is either on or off, no temp adjustment is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Stone Culture

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Update 1/4/2017: After using this daily for a couple of weeks I have found that placing some type of simple cover (like a plastic lid, doesn't need to weigh much at all) over the top of the cup will keep the beverage MUCH warmer than without a lid. Decent quality, on/off switch is conveniently located next to the heat plate (as opposed to on the cord). Used as-is it keeps a cup 'warm', but not hot. I've found that placing a large washer on the heater pad helps transfer heat to the cup of liquid. Also I noticed that placing some type of cover over the cup helps hold the heat in, although it's a bit inconvenient .
customer_reviews.author: BrotherDave

customer_reviews.title: Office must
customer_reviews.text: There have been many times I have brought a cup of coffee into my home office and half way through I go to take a drink and it's cold....unless you were going for the iced coffee vibe, this is not good so I've wanted a mug warmer for a long time, I finally ordered one and now I always have a nice warm/hot cup of coffee within arm's reach
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This does just what I needed it to do, it keeps my coffee at a nice warm temperature. It’s not scalding hot, just nice and warm. Note that when you get towards the bottom of your cup, it will get hotter since there is less liquid. For the first time ever I’ve been able to finish a cup of coffee at work without having to microwave it or make a new cup. I love this and am going to get one for home use. Don’t know why I waited so long! I haven't bothered covering the top of the mug with anything but a napkin. It makes a small difference, but you really don't need to cover it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paint peels off, may be cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Had it 2 days and the paint peels off. Seems this is a common complaint by others. I hope this doesn’t mean the rest of it is cheaply made... Other than that, it has worked well. The coffee warmer is only as good as the surface area of the bottom of your mug. Simple on/off switch. No safety feature or auto-off feature. Product manual also says to unplug it when not in use. Seems the product has had circuitry fried as reported by other reviewers. I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Beck and Heather

customer_reviews.title: Quality is price you pay
customer_reviews.text: The hot plate works and keeps my coffee hot, but the paint on the actual hot plate chipped the very first time I ever used it. I'm worried about how long this is going to last with how cheaply-made it is. If it stops working, I'll go with a better-quality one.
customer_reviews.author: AmberSue

customer_reviews.title: The on-light is not bright enough.
customer_reviews.text: After the second use the black base where you sit your coffee cup started coming off. I guess if it’s painted black for looks that’s sort of okay but if it is for safety that is not good. I don’t like the light at all. It is hard to see that it is on - it’s not large enough or bright enough. I have to be very careful I check to see if it is on or off after each use. Otherwise it does keep the coffee warm enough.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara White

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best little out of the box gadgets I've ever bought! It keeps your hot beverage at the same temperature for as long as your cup is on it. No complaints. It works. However, my only small con is that if you leave the cup on it for a while it will leave a small film on top of your hot beverage. Not sure why it does that, must be a science thing. I've had mine for several years now and works just the same. Every time winter comes around I am soooo thankful I have it.
customer_reviews.author: products333

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome. From reading the reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. From reading the reviews, I knew it would work perfectly. It's mean to keep coffee warm. It is not meant to heat cold coffee up. The fact that it CAN heat cold coffee to a warm temp is testament to the fact this thing so keep your HOT coffee from going cold. The last drink is especially hot and delicious. I work from home and keep the house cool for energy savings and this little guy keeps my coffee from cooling to an undrinkable temp. It works best with coffee you haven't let cool yet. I don't recommend it for taking your cold brew to a toasty temp. I paid $8. We'll worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mama G

customer_reviews.title: Mr Coffee Mug warmer
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old mug warmer so I saw the Mr Coffee one. I thought this is the one, the coffee makers do a good job. Does not really meet my expectations. It keeps my coffee at more of a tepid level not hot. and the switch is hard to operate. I do not recommend this warmer to anyone who has arthritis in their hands or any other hand problem that limits mobility and strength.
customer_reviews.author: granny1

customer_reviews.title: Saves lots of trips to the microwave!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father since he would always be working in his home office and let his coffee go cold, necessitating trips down to the microwave at least three times a day. Now, he leaves his mug on this and no matter how distracted with work he gets, he can always grab a nice warm cup of coffee. Super convenient and it doesn’t take up a lot of space at all. He uses it just about every day. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: njzeus

product_meta.title: Mr. Coffee Mug Warmer, Home, Office, Black
product_meta.description:
Meet your new favorite coffee accessory: the Mr. Coffee Mug Warmer. Place your favorite cup of joe, tea, or cocoa on the plate, and it'll keep it nice and hot for hours—so you can enjoy it at your leisure. It features a convenient on/off switch with an indicator light, and an extended power cord so you can use it just about anywhere.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
For any technical issues contact Manufacture at 1-800-672-6333
feature_bullets: 17 watt mug warmer for use with coffee, tea, hot cocoa & more
Easy to tote and take anywhere
Longer power cord for increased mobility

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars14,325 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
